lead_paragraph: In its third warning of deteriorating results since the Sept. 11 terror attacks, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton said today that its sales in October fell 5 percent from the period last year and that its operating profits for the full year might be 15 percent lower than forecast. The company, which manufactures and markets a wide range of luxury goods under well-known brands like Louis Vuitton leather goods, Kenzo clothing and Dior perfumes, said that the trouble stemmed from the deep slump in a crucial market segment: tourists.
abstract: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, which manufactures and markets wide range of luxury goods, says that its sales in October fell 5 percent from period last year and that its operating profits for full year might be 15 percent lower than last year (M)
